p: In the Guarani-Kaiowá indigenous community, R. palmarum larvae are used as a source of oil for the treatment of wounds to accelerate healing and prevent infection. This oil is also used to treat respiratory ailments through its application to the chest and back. This study presents knowledge and teachings about the insects used by the Guarani-Kaiowá. The record of indigenous TK and the tale of the creation of Mbuku are described in S1 File. Given the scarcity of information regarding the chemical composition and pharmacological properties of R. palmarum oil, we recorded the traditional process for collecting larvae and obtaining R. palmarum larvae oil (RPLO) according to the Guarani-Kaiowá TK. In addition to determining the chemical features of RPLO, we investigated its antioxidant, antimicrobial, and healing properties, as well as its possible toxicity.
